coref: A young Mouse in search of adventure was running along the bank of a pond where lived a Frog. When a Frog saw A young Mouse in search of adventure, a Frog swam to the bank of a pond where lived a Frog and croaked: Won't you pay me a visit? I can promise you a good time if you do. A young Mouse in search of adventure A young Mouse in search of adventure did not need much coaxing, for a Frog was very anxious to see the world and everything in A young Mouse in search of adventure. But though a Frog could swim a little, a Frog did not dare risk going into the pond without some help. a Frog had a plan. a Frog tied A young Mouse in search of adventure's leg to a Frog own with a tough reed. Then into the pond a Frog jumped, dragging a Frog foolish companion with a Frog. A young Mouse in search of adventure soon had enough of A young Mouse in search of adventure and wanted to return to shore; but a Frog had other plans. a Frog pulled A young Mouse in search of adventure down under the water and drowned a Frog. But before a Frog could untie the reed that bound a Frog to the dead Mouse, a Hawk came sailing over the pond. Seeing the body of A young Mouse in search of adventure floating on the water, Hawk swooped down, seized A young Mouse in search of adventure and carried A young Mouse in search of adventure off, with a Frog dangling from A young Mouse in search of adventure leg. Thus at one swoop he had caught both meat and fish for he dinner.
